meanings.definition: hobblebushes: plural noun - a type of shrub with large, showy white flowers
meanings.sent1: The hobblebushes in the garden bloomed beautifully in the spring.
meanings.sent2: I love how the hobblebushes brighten up the forest with their white flowers.
meanings.sent3: The hobblebushes seemed to dance in the breeze, showing off their pretty blooms.
meanings.sent4: The hobblebushes stood out like snowflakes against the green backdrop of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hobblebushes looked like little clouds of flowers scattered across the landscape.

meanings.definition: hobblebushes: verb - to move clumsily or with difficulty, as if hindered by obstacles
meanings.sent1: She had to hobblebushes through the crowded room with her hands full of books.
meanings.sent2: The injured dog tried to hobblebushes back to its owner, struggling to walk.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to hobblebushes across the ice, slipping and sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: After the long hike, my legs felt like they were hobblebushing through mud.
meanings.sent5: The old car seemed to hobblebushes along the bumpy road, barely moving forward.
